sens.mc: a person who impartially decides or resolves a dispute or controversy
sens.vi: Mom usually acts as umpire in our frequent squabbles over the sailboat.
sens.rel: justice, magistrate; interm ediary, mediator, negotiator; conciliator, go-between, peacemaker, reconciler; decider

sens.mc: to give an opinion about (something at issue or in dispute)
sens.vi: In our family, disputes regarding the use of the pool are umpired by Dad.
sens.syn: adjudge, adjudicate, arbitrate, decide, determine, referee, rule (on), settle, ump ire
sens.rel: consider, hear, ponder, weigh; size (up); mediate, moderate, negotiate; prosecute, try; find (for or against)
